item.title: Report X-2025041287
item.description:
Report X-2025041287

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-13
  • City: PITTSBURGH
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the PITR location a fiberboard was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans with positive closure tabs and the lid opened on one can causing the release. All contents of the shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025040487
item.description:
Report E-2025040487

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: BRISTOL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the, observed that the released material impacted an area measuring approximately 53ft-by-5ft of the trailer floor and the asphalt parking lot estimated that twenty (20) gallons of material was released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and gathered the spent materials. The recovered absorbents were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was overpacked into one metal drum. The impacted trailer floor and asphalt were pressure-washed to remove the staining, and the rinse water was collected and containerized into one additional 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was transported offsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040333
item.description:
Report E-2025040333

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-12T03:42:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-14
  • City: ETNA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The drum was unloaded from the pick up unit and staged in preparation for transport to its destination. Shortly after staging, the operations supervisor discovered the leaking drum. After minimizing the spill, a small, pinhole sized leak was discovered on the bottom of the drum. The leak was active for about 30 minutes. The drum was placed in an overpack container and neutralizer was spread on the spill by HAZWOPER trained on site personnel. Once neutralized, the spill was cleaned up and packed into an overpack container in preparation for disposition.
